info.value: Blue whales live in all the world's oceans, occasionally swimming in small groups. These graceful swimmers travel through the ocean at more than five miles an hour but accelerate to more than 20 miles an hour when they are angry. Blue whales are among the loudest animals on the planet. They emit a series of pulses and sounds, and it's thought that, in good conditions, blue whales can hear each other up to 1,000 miles away. Scientists think that they use these methods not only to communicate, but, along with their excellent hearing, to navigate the lightless ocean depth.
